text:
P15/4420, P15/4421, P15/4422, P15/4472) is located approximately 10km 
 southwest of Kalgoorlie. 
 Work  completed  during  the  reporting  period  included  gridding,  Rotary 
 Air Blast drilling and rock chip sampling. 
 There  were  several  anomalous  assays  returned  from  RAB  drilling 
 including  6m  @  1.04g/t  (AVR284),  3m  @  0.78g/t  (AVR289)  and  10m  @ 
 0.5g/t (AVR295).

the project area (Figure 3).  The entire package has been metamorphosed to

 Two main deformation zones exist within the project.  The Zuleika Shear Zone

18.text: zone of attenuation and stratigraphic mismatch, which in places can be over

19.text: 1km wide.  This structure hosts the Kundana gold camp, which has recently

20.text: grown to over seven million ounces in size.

22.text: The  Kunanalling  Shear  Zone  in  the  west  is  a  well-defined  transcurrent

23.text: structure  that  varies  in  width  from  100  metres  to  1km.    It  comprises

24.text: anastomosing  zones  of  intensely  foliated  rock  that  surrounds  pods  of  less

25.text: deformed rock.  This shear zone and its associated splay structures link the

26.text: Mount Marion gold deposit (1.2Moz) in the south to a string of smaller historic

27.text: workings  in  the  north  including;  Dryden’s  Find,  Northlander,  Kunanalling,

30.text: The regolith geology is highly variable ranging between areas of outcropping

 The regolith geology is highly variable ranging between areas of outcropping 
 basement to samphire flats.

7.text: There  was  one  RAB  programme  carried  out  during  the  reporting  period.  A

8.text: total of 97 holes were drilled for 2,863m by Challenge Drilling from Boulder,

9.text: Kalgoorlie, within the west and eastern tenement blocks of the Avoca project.

11.text: The  drilling  in  the  west  took  place  on  Prospecting  Licenses  P15/4420  and

12.text: P15/4418 around the Dryden’s Find Prospect. A total of 48 holes (AVR283-

13.text: 330)  were  drilled  for  1,357m.    Drilling  was  designed  to  infill  and  extend  on

16.text: Kunnanalling Shear Zone. Drilling intersected an argillaceous sulphidic black

17.text: shale and felsic volcaniclastic package of Black Flag association, as well as

18.text: variably  silicified/chloritised  high  mag  basalts,  dolerites,  gabbros  and  talc

text:
There  was  one  RAB  programme  carried  out  during  the  reporting  period.  A 
 total of 97 holes were drilled for 2,863m by Challenge Drilling from Boulder, 
 Kalgoorlie, within the west and eastern tenement blocks of the Avoca project.  
 The  drilling  in  the  west  took  place  on  Prospecting  Licenses  P15/4420  and 
 P15/4418 around the Dryden’s Find Prospect. A total of 48 holes (AVR283-
 330)  were  drilled  for  1,357m.    Drilling  was  designed  to  infill  and  extend  on 
 Kunnanalling Shear Zone. Drilling intersected an argillaceous sulphidic black 
 linear  anomaly  associated  with 
 the 
 target  a 
 shale and felsic volcaniclastic package of Black Flag association, as well as 
 variably  silicified/chloritised  high  mag  basalts,  dolerites,  gabbros  and  talc

10.text: Samples (weighing approx 2kg) were composited to 4m using a PVC spear

11.text: and submitted to Genalysis of Kalgoorlie for analysis. Duplicates were taken

12.text: every 20 samples for quality control. Samples were assayed for Au using an

13.text: Aqua Regia (Hydrochloric and Nitric acid) digest.  The combination of these

14.text: acids  (forming  Nitrosol  Chloride)  is  used  to  dissolve  the  mineral  matrix  and

15.text: hold the metals in solution. An organic solvent is added (DIBK) to assemble

16.text: the Au and the elemental concentration is determined. Determination was by

17.text: Graphite furnace Atomic Absorption Spectrometry (AAS) to a detection limit of

19.text: assayed  for  Au  using  a  400g  “Leach  Well”  digest  utilising  a  four-hour  leach

20.text: with solvent extraction (DIBK) and AAS determination.

text:
Samples (weighing approx 2kg) were composited to 4m using a PVC spear 
 and submitted to Genalysis of Kalgoorlie for analysis. Duplicates were taken 
 every 20 samples for quality control. Samples were assayed for Au using an 
 Aqua Regia (Hydrochloric and Nitric acid) digest.  The combination of these 
 acids  (forming  Nitrosol  Chloride)  is  used  to  dissolve  the  mineral  matrix  and 
 hold the metals in solution. An organic solvent is added (DIBK) to assemble 
 the Au and the elemental concentration is determined. Determination was by 
 Graphite furnace Atomic Absorption Spectrometry (AAS) to a detection limit of 
 1ppb.  Anomalous  interceptions  (=/>  200ppb/0.2ppm)  were  resampled  and 
 assayed  for  Au  using  a  400g  “Leach  Well”  digest  utilising  a  four-hour  leach 
 with solvent extraction (DIBK) and AAS determination. 
 - 8 -

13.text: A recently granted tenement (E15/738) south of the project has received little

14.text: exploration  interest.  The  trace  of  the  Kunanalling  shear  zone,  which  hosts

15.text: anomalous  intercepts  associated  with  the  Dryden’s  Find  Prospect,  runs

16.text: through the western part of the tenement. This area would benefit from a soil

text:

 anomalous  intercepts  associated  with  the  Dryden’s  Find  Prospect,  runs 
 through the western part of the tenement. This area would benefit from a soil
